summary: The one in which you defend Wanda
body:
The one in which you defend Wanda

This is a Wanda x Fem! Masculine! Reader. So if you don’t like gxg or anything like that then don’t read.

Third POV

Today is a big day. Today Wanda and (Y/N) finally tell the team that they are together as a couple. You’d think it would be easy, seeing as they have known these people for years and that they are practically family now but, it’s really not.

“Oh god, oh god!” A stressed Wanda said as she paced around the bedroom, (Y/N) was sitting on on the bed, leaning back on her palms with her head moving with Wanda as she paced around the room. “I was so confident yesterday that this would all turn out okay, but now i’m having all these thoughts and different outcomes of what could happen poping up in my mind!”

“It’ll be okay Wanda.” (Y/N) reassured Wanda as she stood up from the bed and walked up to Wanda before gently grabbing her shoulders, “Wanda look at me.”

Wanda looked up into (Y/N)’s (E/C) eye’s, “Everything will be okay, if they don’t except us for who we are and that we love each other then i’ll personally go down there and kick their ass’s so hard that they’ll end up in Central Park.” (Y/N) says with a chuckle. Wanda giggled, “There’s my girl.”

“You wanna do it now and get it over with or do it later at when we’re all having dinner?” (Y/N) said looking down at Wanda with love in her eyes, “At dinner,” Wanda replyed looking up at (Y/N) with confidence now in her dark brown eyes and a smile on her face. “Thanks for calming me down (Y/N). You’re the best.”

“I know.” (Y/N) said with a cheeky smirk on her face as moved her hands up to Wanda’s face and placing a lingering kiss on her lips. The kiss was interrupted by a knock on the door, “Hey guys dinners ready!”

“Coming!”

-Time skip to dinner-

Wanda and (Y/N) were hoping that dinner would just go by smoothly but nobody ever gets a happy ending do they?

“So we um…actually have something to um..t-tell you guys.” Wanda said nervously, clenching and unclenching her hands under the table. (Y/N) reached under the table and grabbed her shaking hand, to help her calm down.

“Sure what is it-” Steve said before getting cut off.

“(L/N)!” Fury’s voice filled the room.

“Yes sir?” (Y/N) replyed looking up from her seat at the dinner table only to see the director in all of his glory.

“I need to speak with you outside for a moment.” (Y/N) squeezed Wanda’s hand before standing up and walking out of the room.

“What were you saying Wanda?” Steve asked kindly. He was always like a father to Wanda and she a daughter to him. “I-I ummm…” Wanda replyed looking at everyone. They all had kind looks on their faces as they waited for Wanda to continue what’s she was saying, “You okay Wanda?”

‘Now or never’ she thought as she closed her eyes and took a deep breath. She opened her eyes before she finally said it, “(Y/N) and I are in a relationship together.”

(Y/N)’s POV

I walked out of the room with Fury, I stopped and turned to face him, “You needed to speak to me sir?”

“We need you in New Mexico.” He stated

“Why?” I asked with a confused look on my face. Suddenly Fury got quiet, “I heard about you and Wanda.”

'Oh god..’ I thought before he continued, “And I also know that you guys were gonna tell everyone today, so I thought if things went south you and Wanda could have a little vacation in New Mexico, while I talk to everyone and set them straight about your relationship with Wanda.”

“Wow. Thank you Fury that’s amaz-” I was cut off by yelling in the kitchen, “WHAT!?”, “YOU CANT BE SERIOUS!”

“What the hell?” I mumbled as I ran back with Fury into the kitchen only to see a very scared looking Wanda and very angry looking Avengers.

“DO YOU HAVE ANY IDEA HOW THE MEDIA IS GONNA TAKE THIS IF IT GETS OUT TO THE WORLD!?” Tony yelled at Wanda while everyone else agreed, by this time she was tearing up.

I ran over to Wanda, “You okay baby?”

She quickly got up and hugged me, burying her head in my shoulder, I hugged back and talked to her in her mind to her, 'Fury is sending us to New Mexico for a little vacation. He knew about us and he set it up for us incase thing go south.’ 'Really?’ 'Really, really. Now why don’t you go pack and I’ll deal with these fuckers.’ She giggled out loud with a smile before she left the kitchen.

“Now…Where do we wanna start?” I said as I turned to the group with a glare. Now I don’t get angry a lot, but right now I’m fucking pissed.

“When were you gonna tell us!” Clint asked leaning forward on the table with his hands.

“We were hoping to tell you guys right now, together Barton.” I snaped back leaning forward on the table with my hands, trying to mimic him.

“WHAT ABOUT THE MEDIA!? IF THEY FIND OUT ABOUT THIS WHAT DO YOU THINK THEY’D DO!?” Tony screamed at me pointing an accusing finger at me.

“I DON’T CARE ABOUT THE MEDIA! I DON’T CARE ABOUT THEIR OPINIONS! AND HONESTLY I DON’T CARE ABOUT YOURS EITHER STARK! I LOVE WANDA AND NOTHING WILL EVER CHANGE THAT! ESPECIALLY, NOT A ROOM FULL OF JACKASS’S WHO I THOUGHT WERE MY FRIENDS!” I screamed back, everyone was shocked to say the least, even Fury was surprised. “Me and Wanda are gonna be gone for a while, were going to New Mexico while Fury sets you guys straight about my relationship with Wanda.” I say with a glare before walking out of the room, I stop next to Fury, “We’ll be ready in 30 Fury.”

“(L/N)!” Fury’s voice filled the room.

“Yes sir?” (Y/N) replyed looking up from her seat at the dinner table only to see the director in all of his glory.

“I need to speak with you outside for a moment.” (Y/N) squeezed Wanda’s hand before standing up and walking out of the room.

(Y/N)’s POV

I walked out of the room with Fury, I stopped and turned to face him, “You needed to speak to me sir?”

“We need you in New Mexico.” He stated

“Why?” I asked with a confused look on my face. Suddenly Fury got quiet, “I heard about you and Wanda.”

'Oh god..’ I thought before he continued, “And I also know that you guys were gonna tell everyone today, so I thought if things went south you and Wanda could have a little vacation in New Mexico, while I talk to everyone and set them straight about your relationship with Wanda.”

“Wow. Thank you Fury that’s amaz-” I was cut off by yelling in the kitchen, “WHAT!?”, “YOU CANT BE SERIOUS!”

“DO YOU HAVE ANY IDEA HOW THE MEDIA IS GONNA TAKE THIS IF IT GETS OUT TO THE WORLD!?” Tony yelled at Wanda while everyone else agreed, by this time she was tearing up.

I ran over to Wanda, “You okay baby?”

She quickly got up and hugged me, burying her head in my shoulder, I hugged back and talked to her in her mind to her, 'Fury is sending us to New Mexico for a little vacation. He knew about us and he set it up for us incase thing go south.’ 'Really?’ 'Really, really. Now why don’t you go pack and I’ll deal with these fuckers.’ She giggled out loud with a smile before she left the kitchen.

“Now…Where do we wanna start?” I said as I turned to the group with a glare. Now I don’t get angry a lot, but right now I’m fucking pissed.

“When were you gonna tell us!” Clint asked leaning forward on the table with his hands.

“We were hoping to tell you guys right now, together Barton.” I snaped back leaning forward on the table with my hands, trying to mimic him.

“WHAT ABOUT THE MEDIA!? IF THEY FIND OUT ABOUT THIS WHAT DO YOU THINK THEY’D DO!?” Tony screamed at me pointing an accusing finger at me.

“I DON’T CARE ABOUT THE MEDIA! I DON’T CARE ABOUT THEIR OPINIONS! AND HONESTLY I DON’T CARE ABOUT YOURS EITHER STARK! I LOVE WANDA AND NOTHING WILL EVER CHANGE THAT! ESPECIALLY, NOT A ROOM FULL OF JACKASS’S WHO I THOUGHT WERE MY FRIENDS!” I screamed back, everyone was shocked to say the least, even Fury was surprised. “Me and Wanda are gonna be gone for a while, were going to New Mexico while Fury sets you guys straight about my relationship with Wanda.” I say with a glare before walking out of the room, I stop next to Fury, “We’ll be ready in 30 Fury.”

summary: Fandom: Marvel / Original Characters Words: 1,250 A/N: So... I was really hesitant to post this because it has my OCs in it...
body:
Fandom: Marvel / Original Characters

Words: 1,250

A/N: So… I was really hesitant to post this because it has my OCs in it (Daniel, Diana, Cameron, and Bea) but @coulson-is-an-avenger likes my writing so? I don’t expect this to get a lot of notes, but if y’all read it know that Cameron is deaf and can read lips. Thanks for reading if you do ❤️ (Also sorry if the tense changes I’ve been experimenting)

“Guys, look!” In a blink of an eye, Diana is suddenly across the room and pressing her entire body against the cool glass window that stretches from floor to ceiling. In the distance, above Time Square, fireworks are being set off, lighting the night sky with an assault of bright colors. Peter is soon by her side, the two ooh- and ahh-ing at every spark. The adults join them shortly, all holding a glass of champagne to be shared when the ball drops.

The only ones who stay behind, sitting on the floor wrapped in a warm blanket, are Daniel and Cameron. Cameron sits close to the other boy, shyly running his fingers over the top of his hand. Daniel notices and gently takes his hand, giving a reassuring squeeze and smile. Cameron’s face blooms a lovely red and he looks away, a ghost of a smile trying to hide behind his mess of a hairdo. Daniel taps his shoulder to get his attention, and Cameron doesn’t hesitate to look in his direction.

Happy New Year.

Cameron smiles and mirrors him. Happy New Year. In the background, Peter and Diana are counting down at the top of their lungs. Mr. Stark, Aunt May, and Bea start toasting their glasses as the year comes to a close and a new one begins. The excitement in the room only adds to the chaos of Cameron’s beating heart, and he can’t take his eyes off of Daniel, the fireworks reflecting off his glasses and illuminating his face. The small smile, his parted lips, and the short chuckle from Diana and Peter’s over-the-top excitement as the clock strikes midnight make his emotions overflow and his head spin. Daniel looks at him and flashes a grin, the joy from the others infectious.

“Happy New Year, Cam-”

Cameron can’t control himself, and soon he’s leaning forward, his lips practically collide with Daniel’s. The taller boy has to use both of his hands to keep them steady, digging his fingers into the carpet as Cameron presses more and more into him, wanting to be engulfed in him, wanting to fuse with him. At first the kiss is sloppy, uncoordinated, but Cameron can feel Daniel’s lips try to find a rhythm with his, and soon they’re kissing effortlessly. Cameron can feel Daniel moan into the kiss, and soon his hand is on his cheek, pulling him closer, their jaws moving simultaneously, like they were meant for each other. They part for air, Cameron releases a shaky breath, and Daniel sits back to take it all in.

Cameron keeps his eyes closed, too lost in the moment, and leans in for a round two but isn’t reciprocated. His eyes open slowly and he sees Daniel… absolutely stunned. His eyes, so beautiful and easy to get lost in, are wide and full of… Shock? Surprise? His thin lips, so wonderful to kiss and Cameron’s waited so long to feel them, are pressed into a line. Cameron’s scared that he’s lost him and waves his hands in front of his face in an attempt to bring him back from whatever dimension he’s gone to, from whatever thought he’s lost in.

Suddenly Daniel is standing, his eyes fixed nowhere in particular but not looking at Cameron. Bathroom. The sign is so fast that Cameron barely recognizes it, and soon he’s met with Daniel’s back, his slim body walking away from him towards the hallway. Cameron turns around to see that no one’s noticed, all too preoccupied with conversation while Diana and Peter set off celebratory poppers back and forth. He quietly sneaks away in pursuit of Daniel, who God knows what is going through his mind.

Cameron wanders down the hallway aimlessly until he notices the light in the bathroom is on. He approaches the door, hesitantly lifts his hand, and knocks softly. He waits a while, and when there’s no response or sign of the door opening, he lifts his hand to knock again. As he brings his knuckles down to rap against the soft wood, the door suddenly swings open, and his hand is hovered over Daniel’s hoodie-clad chest. Surprised, he reels back and looks up to find Daniel’s face. Water drips from stands of his hair, and his cheeks look softer. He must have just washed his face, Cameron assumes.

Sorry. It’s the first thing Daniel signs, and there is regret in his eyes. Cameron feels worry curl in his nerves.

Are you okay? Cameron’s worried that maybe Daniel wasn’t ready and he’s invaded his privacy in some way. I’m sorry if I surprised you. I’ve just wanted to kiss you for a while, and I thought it was the right time.

Daniel’s mouth gapes in surprise, opening and closing like a fish. He fumbles with his hands, not sure what to sign, his brows furrowed and lips pressed together in confusion. You wanted to kiss me? You like me?

Cameron is taken by surprise. He thought that was pretty obvious. Yeah? I thought we’ve been dating for a while now. Daniel’s mouth hangs open, and Cameron can’t believe how dense this boy is. I’ve liked you since I first met you, Daniel. Maybe I shouldn’t have assumed we were dating, but I thought it was pretty obvious. Daniel blushes and fumbles with the strings of his hoodie. Cameron smiles and steps closer, though his body trembles as nervousness rushes through his body. Do you like me?

Now Daniel gets defensive. Of course I like you! I- His face might as well be on fire, and Cameron can’t help but find him absolutely adorable. I’ve liked you for a while too. The confession is shy, the signs fast and nearly jumbled together in one big mess. Cameron exhales relief and closes the distance between them, his hand resting on Daniel’s chest. He relaxes as he feels Daniel’s hand play with his hair. I really like you. Their eyes meet and soon they’re kissing again, gentle and light but passionate. Daniel’s fingers rake through Cameron’s hair, his other hand resting on the small of his back. Cameron’s hands find Daniel’s shoulders, holding onto him as if his life depended on it.

For once in his life, Daniel feels safe. The thoughts, all the negative ones, stop and all he can think about is kissing Cameron, and how nice he feels, how nice this feels. The warmth swirling his stomach, his hands on Cameron and Cameron’s hands on him. He wants this, and Cameron wants it too. Cameron wants him. Daniel pulls apart from the kiss and embraces Cameron, holding him so close as if he would disappear if he let him go, as if he’s the only thing holding him on to this earth. He feels Cameron’s hands rest on his back, gently rubbing his shoulder blades, until one of his hands firmly press into his back. Daniel clings onto the fabric of Cameron’s shirt, pulling him even closer, and Cameron’s hand presses even further into the cloth of Daniel’s hoodie.

Pressed into his back is the international sign for I love you, and Cameron’s trying to let him know even though he can’t see. I love you. I love you, I love you, I love you.

Daniel’s body trembles with an overwhelming feeling of joy, joy of being alive, of being here, of being here with Cameron, of Cameron loving him-

His hand shakily forms, thumb out, index and pinky fingers up, pressing into Cameron’s back.

I love you.

Fandom: Marvel / Original Characters

Words: 1,250

A/N: So… I was really hesitant to post this because it has my OCs in it (Daniel, Diana, Cameron, and Bea) but @coulson-is-an-avenger likes my writing so? I don’t expect this to get a lot of notes, but if y’all read it know that Cameron is deaf and can read lips. Thanks for reading if you do ❤️ (Also sorry if the tense changes I’ve been experimenting)

“Guys, look!” In a blink of an eye, Diana is suddenly across the room and pressing her entire body against the cool glass window that stretches from floor to ceiling. In the distance, above Time Square, fireworks are being set off, lighting the night sky with an assault of bright colors. Peter is soon by her side, the two ooh- and ahh-ing at every spark. The adults join them shortly, all holding a glass of champagne to be shared when the ball drops.

The only ones who stay behind, sitting on the floor wrapped in a warm blanket, are Daniel and Cameron. Cameron sits close to the other boy, shyly running his fingers over the top of his hand. Daniel notices and gently takes his hand, giving a reassuring squeeze and smile. Cameron’s face blooms a lovely red and he looks away, a ghost of a smile trying to hide behind his mess of a hairdo. Daniel taps his shoulder to get his attention, and Cameron doesn’t hesitate to look in his direction.

Happy New Year.

Cameron smiles and mirrors him. Happy New Year. In the background, Peter and Diana are counting down at the top of their lungs. Mr. Stark, Aunt May, and Bea start toasting their glasses as the year comes to a close and a new one begins. The excitement in the room only adds to the chaos of Cameron’s beating heart, and he can’t take his eyes off of Daniel, the fireworks reflecting off his glasses and illuminating his face. The small smile, his parted lips, and the short chuckle from Diana and Peter’s over-the-top excitement as the clock strikes midnight make his emotions overflow and his head spin. Daniel looks at him and flashes a grin, the joy from the others infectious.

“Happy New Year, Cam-”

Cameron can’t control himself, and soon he’s leaning forward, his lips practically collide with Daniel’s. The taller boy has to use both of his hands to keep them steady, digging his fingers into the carpet as Cameron presses more and more into him, wanting to be engulfed in him, wanting to fuse with him. At first the kiss is sloppy, uncoordinated, but Cameron can feel Daniel’s lips try to find a rhythm with his, and soon they’re kissing effortlessly. Cameron can feel Daniel moan into the kiss, and soon his hand is on his cheek, pulling him closer, their jaws moving simultaneously, like they were meant for each other. They part for air, Cameron releases a shaky breath, and Daniel sits back to take it all in.

Cameron keeps his eyes closed, too lost in the moment, and leans in for a round two but isn’t reciprocated. His eyes open slowly and he sees Daniel… absolutely stunned. His eyes, so beautiful and easy to get lost in, are wide and full of… Shock? Surprise? His thin lips, so wonderful to kiss and Cameron’s waited so long to feel them, are pressed into a line. Cameron’s scared that he’s lost him and waves his hands in front of his face in an attempt to bring him back from whatever dimension he’s gone to, from whatever thought he’s lost in.

Suddenly Daniel is standing, his eyes fixed nowhere in particular but not looking at Cameron. Bathroom. The sign is so fast that Cameron barely recognizes it, and soon he’s met with Daniel’s back, his slim body walking away from him towards the hallway. Cameron turns around to see that no one’s noticed, all too preoccupied with conversation while Diana and Peter set off celebratory poppers back and forth. He quietly sneaks away in pursuit of Daniel, who God knows what is going through his mind.

title: winter wonderland
body:
Steve found Tony in the workshop, hunched over his worktable. He was only wearing threadbare sweatpants and an old hoodie, and Steve could see the small involuntary shivers that ran through him.

“Tony,” he said, more in greeting than anything else. 

Tony didn’t move, simply melting back into Steve’s touch, and Steve laughed a little, encircling him with warm firm arms. 

“You’re warm,” Tony said, his eyes fighting to stay open. 

“I should hope so,” Steve responded, slowly walking backwards, dragging Tony along with him. 

“Where are you taking me, Rogers? If you wanted me back in bed all you had to do was ask,” Tony murmured, but the words fell flat due to the slur in Tony’s voice.

“Would you have come if I did?” Steve asked, shifting Tony’s weight a little so that he could pull him into the elevator.

“Depends on what you were asking for.”

“Sex?” Steve ventured, leaning against the wall of the elevator, Tony’s back pressed up against him. 

“100%”

“Sleep?” Steve tried again, and Tony laughed a little.

“Yeah, okay, probably not, but still, I’m Tony Stark. I don’t need sleep.”

Steve rolled his eyes. His husband was impossible. But god, he was cute like this. “Of course, Tony.”

“Is that sarcasm I hear? You’re my husband, you can’t talk to me like that.”

Steve huffed a little, then stopped in the hallway to suck a bruise to the side of Tony’s neck. “What were you saying, Tony?”

“No, nothing, I’m sorry, keep doing that,” Tony babbled. 

Steve grinned as he finally pulled Tony into their room. 

“Jarvis, window mode,” he said softly, before sitting down on their bed and tugging Tony into his arms. 

The walls that had previously been black before slowly faded into a view of New York City. Snow fell around them, and Steve almost felt as if he was in a movie, or a snow globe. Steve arranged the giant pile of feather soft blankets and sheets around them, creating a modified cocoon of warmth.

Tony mumbled something, probably voicing his dissent at being forced back into bed, but Steve shushed him and pressed a soft kiss to his forehead. 

“You can sleep,” he murmured, and Tony made a soft noise of agreement before snuggling further into Steve’s arms. Steve smiled softly, tugging a blanket up and around him. 

They stayed like that for the rest of the day, Tony sleeping softly against Steve, the snow falling around them. 

(I wanted to write this for AGES but i couldn’t find the motivation. Now, I guess, it is here.)

title: Pepperony Exchange Fic
body:
Title: The Force Will Be With you, Always

Author: microgirl

Recipient: @catsarecutebutaliens

Rating: G

Summary: Aunt May invites Tony and Pepper to spend New Year’s Eve with she, Peter, and Ned.

Author’s Note: This is my exchange fic for @catsarecutebutaliens.  I am so, so sorry you had to wait until the very last day for your fic.  I started your story, but got half way through before I hated everything I’d written.  My friend gave me a much better prompt and this fic poured out. I hope you enjoy it

 “Okay boys!” May announced, walking into the living room.  “It’s time for our New Year’s Eve checklist: Popcorn?”

“Check!” Ned said, holding up the microwave bags.

“Candy?”

“Junior Mints for you,” Peter pointed to the boxes on the coffee table.  “M&M’s for Ned. Reeses Pieces for me.”

“And the Chinese food should be here in a few minutes,” May clapped her hands together.  “I know I don’t have to ask about the movies.”

Ned smirked, tapping the blu-ray cases.  “Right here.”

“Then we are all set!” The sound of knocking interrupted May. “That should be the food, Peter. Can you get that?”

Hopping up from the couch, Peter went to the door.  He opened it, surprised to not find the typical, nondescript delivery person, but to see Tony Stark and Pepper Potts on the other side.

“Hey, kid,” Tony grinned.

“Tony!” Peter blinked in shock.  Even after all of these months it was still weird to call him by his first name.  “What are you doing here?”

“Moon lighting as a delivery man,” Tony replied, carrying a big box full of Chinese food.  “I decided research and development for Stark Industries wasn’t enough.”

Pepper rolled her eyes. “Just ignore him, that’s what I do.”

“Peter, stop gawking and let them in.”  May held out her arms to Pepper for a hug.  “How are you, dear?”

“I’m doing wonderful. Thank you so much for inviting us.”

Inviting us? Peter wondered.  Wait, was that why they were here?  Since when were the Starks spending New Year’s Eve with them?  May hadn’t said anything about that.

Tony followed May to the dining room where he placed the box on the table.  “Thank you so much for picking up the food.  How much do we owe you?” she asked.

Shaking his head, Tony waved his hand.  “Nothing. We practically bought out the restaurant to cover all of the cravings of my very lovely pregnant wife.”

And he wasn’t kidding. Peering inside the box, Peter found enough take-out boxes to feed three times as many people as there were in the apartment.  

“Plus I wanted you guys to be able to get some crab cheese wontons without losing a limb,” Tony said simply as he took off his sunglasses.

Ned and Peter snickered until Pepper narrowed her eyes at her husband.  “What have I said about making fun of my cravings?”

“‘Shut up before I rip your arm off?’”

When Pepper nodded, Tony then quietly said to the boys, “See? Loss of limbs.”

May led Pepper to the living room, taking her coat and purse.  “How are you feeling?”

“Good,” Pepper grinned, sitting on the couch.  She settled her hands over her cute little baby bump.  “Morgan is an active little guy.”

May smiled.  “We’ll eat here in the living room.  Peter and Ned, can you bring the food, and I’ll get the drinks.”

Peter stepped in the kitchen while May was filling glasses with root beer.  “What are they doing here?” he whispered, a touch of anxiety in his question.  

“I invited them,” May answered simply.

“I know, but why?”

Before she could answer, Tony called from the living room, “So what are we watching?”

“Star Wars!” Ned said happily.  “We watch A New Hope and time the movie so the Death Star blows up at the stroke of midnight.”

Much to Peter’s frustration, May left the kitchen to serve drinks before she answered Peter’s question. “The boys have added Rogue One to tonight’s viewing lineup.”

He couldn’t fathom why she invited the Starks to their little New Year’s Eve celebration. First, Peter figured Pepper and Tony would have been at a swanky and hip Manhattan party.  But, he knew May never cared for Tony; she voiced her dislike about Tony when Peter talked about his “internship.”

Then she found out Peter was Spider-Man and Tony was responsible for building not one, but two suits.  Peter stayed with Tony through the final battle with Thanos, post being released from the Soul Stone; the move nearly got Peter killed permanently.  And now Tony was his mentor as Peter finished his senior year of high school.  Peter spent a lot of late nights at Tony’s workshop, meaning he didn’t see May nearly as much.

 With all of this, he couldn’t imagine why May wanted Tony in her home.  Swallowing hard, Peter wondered if this would be the night May would tell Tony to stay away from her nephew.

Forty-five minutes later, Peter still couldn’t get over the fact he was sitting on the floor in his living room on New Year’s Eve with Tony Stark and Pepper Potts, eating Chinese food and watching Rogue One.

“So how long have you guys been doing this?” Pepper asked.

Peter thought for a moment. “Uh, ever since I lived with Uncle Ben and Aunt May.  Uncle Ben was a big Star Wars fan.”  May smiled at him, and he didn’t miss the sheen in her eyes.

It had been their New Year’s Eve tradition to watch the Original Trilogy.  When Peter was ten, he and Uncle Ben had figured out when to start A New Hope to where the Death Star blew up right at midnight.  That year, the three of them cheered like they were Rebels at that climatic moment.

But the first New Year’s Eve after Uncle Ben died, Peter was invited to a party at Abe’s house.  The idea of leaving May alone that night…just made Peter feel sick inside.  So he’d told Ned he was staying with May, and Ned joined them as well.  The tradition stayed alive with the three of them.

“We used to always watch the movies in order,” Peter went on.  “But then we discovered it was more fun to watch A New Hope closer to midnight.”

“The boys will continue to watch the rest of the Original Trilogy after midnight, but don’t feel obligated to stay for that,” May said.

“But so we’re not waiting until 10:02, we start with Rogue One now,” Ned happily explained.  “We keep everything in order.”

When the Rebels had successfully gotten the Death Star plans to Princess Leia, the little group had enough time before the next movie started to stretch, use the bathroom, and refresh drinks and food

At exactly 10:02:43, Peter began A New Hope.  When the Rebels were setting up for the invasion of the stormtroopers, Tony offhandedly commented, “You know, I remember when Dad got a phone call from George Lucas.”

“WHAT?!?!” Peter and Ned exclaimed at the same time.

Swallowing a sip of root beer, Tony nodded.  “Yeah, George Lucas spoke to Dad about some of the weapons design for the movie.”

“Are you serious?” Ned asked, his eyes wide and unflinching.

“George Lucas. Your dad knew George Lucas.”  Peter could not believe his ears.  How the hell did he not know this??

“George even gave Dad tickets to the movie premiere.”

“WHAT?!?!?”

Pepper laughed. “Baby, you can’t casually drop bombs like that to two Star Wars fans.”

“I remember when Dad got home from his meeting with George.  He thought the plot of the movie was the silliest thing he’d ever heard. After we got home from the movie, Dad said George was the real genius.”

“George,” Ned practically squealed.  “You call him George and actually know the man.  Do you still talk to him?”

Peter fired out, “Did Howard help with the design of the Death Star too?”

“Did you help with the design of the Death Star?”

“Can you make a blaster?”

“Can you make a lightsaber?”

Tony laughed.  “That was actually the one weapon Dad was curious about making.  I think he tried designing something for it.”

“Did he manage to make one?” Peter asked excitedly.

Tony shook his head. “No.”

Peter deflated for a second before grinning at Ned.  “I bet Shuri could make one.”

“Shuri could totally make a lightsaber,” Ned agreed with a massive smile.

May shook her head. “No, no, no.  You are not asking Shuri to make you a lightsaber.”

“What?” Peter protested. “Why not?”

“Because I like our apartment, and I don’t want you to destroy everything with a laser sword.”

Peter scoffed.  “It’s not like we’d be using it here.”

“Yeah, boys,” Tony agreed, swiping his smartphone screen.  “No lightsabers.”

“That goes for you too,” Pepper said.

“What?!”

She pointed to his phone.  “I know you are about to text Shuri and you do not need a lightsaber.”

“Why not?”

Closing her eyes, Pepper shook her head.  “I don’t even have time to explain to you all of the reasons you shouldn’t have a functioning lightsaber.”  She scooted to the end of the couch cushion, and Tony jumped to his feet to help her up. “No lightsaber.”

After she left for the bathroom, Tony leaned down to Peter and Ned and spoke to where Aunt May couldn’t hear him.  “We’ll call Shuri later this week.”  Peter and Ned nodded eagerly, sharing their signature handshake.  When Pepper rejoined them, Tony winked at the boys.

The rest of the city was counting down to the New Year as Han Solo said, “You’re all clear, kid. Now let’s blow this thing and go home.”  But no one in the apartment joined in.

Peter and Ned stared at the TV screen with the same wide eyed wonder as they had every time they watched this movie.  The thrill of watching the Rebels win this major battle never got old.

And when the Death Star met its inventible end, everyone erupted into cheers.  Leaning down, May smacked a kiss on Peter’s cheek before she did the same to Ned.  Out of the corner of his eye, Peter caught Tony and Pepper in their own kiss. After, Tony bent his head to press his lips to Pepper’s baby bump.  Peter couldn’t help but smile at the sweet gesture.

After they toasted with sparkling apple cider, Tony and Pepper gave their goodbyes.

“Thank you so much for having us,” Pepper hugged Peter before kissing his cheek.  Peter’s face burned with embarrassment.  

“You’re welcome,” he squeaked.

Tony pulled Peter into a hug, giving him a friendly clap on the back.  “This was fun, kid.  You and Ned enjoy the rest of the trilogy.”

After they left, Ned went back to the living room to set up The Empire Strikes Back.  May told them she was turning in.  Before she could leave, Peter asked, “So why did you invite them?”

May’s eyes softened. “I know how much you look up to Tony. And I admit I haven’t been the most welcoming to him.  He’s an important part of your life and I wanted to get to know him better.”  She cupped his cheek.  “I know I can’t provide you with everything, but I am so happy you have a positive male figure in your life again.”

Blinking back his own tears, Peter’s chest flooded with joyous warmth.  He wrapped May up in a bone crushing hug.  For probably the millionth time, he was so, so grateful to have Aunt May.

“I love you,” he croaked.

“I love you too, baby.”

“We used to always watch the movies in order,” Peter went on.  “But then we discovered it was more fun to watch A New Hope closer to midnight.”

“The boys will continue to watch the rest of the Original Trilogy after midnight, but don’t feel obligated to stay for that,” May said.

“But so we’re not waiting until 10:02, we start with Rogue One now,” Ned happily explained.  “We keep everything in order.”

When the Rebels had successfully gotten the Death Star plans to Princess Leia, the little group had enough time before the next movie started to stretch, use the bathroom, and refresh drinks and food

At exactly 10:02:43, Peter began A New Hope.  When the Rebels were setting up for the invasion of the stormtroopers, Tony offhandedly commented, “You know, I remember when Dad got a phone call from George Lucas.”

“WHAT?!?!” Peter and Ned exclaimed at the same time.

Swallowing a sip of root beer, Tony nodded.  “Yeah, George Lucas spoke to Dad about some of the weapons design for the movie.”

“Are you serious?” Ned asked, his eyes wide and unflinching.

“George Lucas. Your dad knew George Lucas.”  Peter could not believe his ears.  How the hell did he not know this??

“George even gave Dad tickets to the movie premiere.”

“WHAT?!?!?”

Pepper laughed. “Baby, you can’t casually drop bombs like that to two Star Wars fans.”

“I remember when Dad got home from his meeting with George.  He thought the plot of the movie was the silliest thing he’d ever heard. After we got home from the movie, Dad said George was the real genius.”

“George,” Ned practically squealed.  “You call him George and actually know the man.  Do you still talk to him?”

Peter fired out, “Did Howard help with the design of the Death Star too?”

“Did you help with the design of the Death Star?”

“Can you make a blaster?”

“Can you make a lightsaber?”

Tony laughed.  “That was actually the one weapon Dad was curious about making.  I think he tried designing something for it.”

“Did he manage to make one?” Peter asked excitedly.

Tony shook his head. “No.”

Peter deflated for a second before grinning at Ned.  “I bet Shuri could make one.”

“Shuri could totally make a lightsaber,” Ned agreed with a massive smile.

May shook her head. “No, no, no.  You are not asking Shuri to make you a lightsaber.”

“What?” Peter protested. “Why not?”

“Because I like our apartment, and I don’t want you to destroy everything with a laser sword.”

Peter scoffed.  “It’s not like we’d be using it here.”

“Yeah, boys,” Tony agreed, swiping his smartphone screen.  “No lightsabers.”

“That goes for you too,” Pepper said.

“What?!”

She pointed to his phone.  “I know you are about to text Shuri and you do not need a lightsaber.”

“Why not?”

Closing her eyes, Pepper shook her head.  “I don’t even have time to explain to you all of the reasons you shouldn’t have a functioning lightsaber.”  She scooted to the end of the couch cushion, and Tony jumped to his feet to help her up. “No lightsaber.”

After she left for the bathroom, Tony leaned down to Peter and Ned and spoke to where Aunt May couldn’t hear him.  “We’ll call Shuri later this week.”  Peter and Ned nodded eagerly, sharing their signature handshake.  When Pepper rejoined them, Tony winked at the boys.

The rest of the city was counting down to the New Year as Han Solo said, “You’re all clear, kid. Now let’s blow this thing and go home.”  But no one in the apartment joined in.

Peter and Ned stared at the TV screen with the same wide eyed wonder as they had every time they watched this movie.  The thrill of watching the Rebels win this major battle never got old.

And when the Death Star met its inventible end, everyone erupted into cheers.  Leaning down, May smacked a kiss on Peter’s cheek before she did the same to Ned.  Out of the corner of his eye, Peter caught Tony and Pepper in their own kiss. After, Tony bent his head to press his lips to Pepper’s baby bump.  Peter couldn’t help but smile at the sweet gesture.

After they toasted with sparkling apple cider, Tony and Pepper gave their goodbyes.

“Thank you so much for having us,” Pepper hugged Peter before kissing his cheek.  Peter’s face burned with embarrassment.  

“You’re welcome,” he squeaked.

Tony pulled Peter into a hug, giving him a friendly clap on the back.  “This was fun, kid.  You and Ned enjoy the rest of the trilogy.”

After they left, Ned went back to the living room to set up The Empire Strikes Back.  May told them she was turning in.  Before she could leave, Peter asked, “So why did you invite them?”

May’s eyes softened. “I know how much you look up to Tony. And I admit I haven’t been the most welcoming to him.  He’s an important part of your life and I wanted to get to know him better.”  She cupped his cheek.  “I know I can’t provide you with everything, but I am so happy you have a positive male figure in your life again.”

Blinking back his own tears, Peter’s chest flooded with joyous warmth.  He wrapped May up in a bone crushing hug.  For probably the millionth time, he was so, so grateful to have Aunt May.

“I love you,” he croaked.

“I love you too, baby.”

Inviting us? Peter wondered.  Wait, was that why they were here?  Since when were the Starks spending New Year’s Eve with them?  May hadn’t said anything about that.

Tony followed May to the dining room where he placed the box on the table.  “Thank you so much for picking up the food.  How much do we owe you?” she asked.

Shaking his head, Tony waved his hand.  “Nothing. We practically bought out the restaurant to cover all of the cravings of my very lovely pregnant wife.”

“Plus I wanted you guys to be able to get some crab cheese wontons without losing a limb,” Tony said simply as he took off his sunglasses.

“‘Shut up before I rip your arm off?’”

“Good,” Pepper grinned, sitting on the couch.  She settled her hands over her cute little baby bump.  “Morgan is an active little guy.”

blog.title: Mads
blog.description: A famous man once sad, “we create our own demons.” Who said it? What does it even mean? Doesn’t matter. I said it ‘cause he said it.

summary: I miss the days when I could go on Wattpad and look up avengers and have a bunch of (questionably good) avengers fanfics with...
body:
I miss the days when I could go on Wattpad and look up avengers and have a bunch of (questionably good) avengers fanfics with OCs pop up with plots relating to phase one.

Now it’s all about this nEW STUFF

And don’t get me wrong, I love the new stuff and I can’t imagine the MCU without Doctor Strange or Spidey, but sometimes I miss the simplier times 😔😔😔😔 y’know, with fics about all of the avengers living in the tower each with their own floors customized for them by Tony.

The old days were cool man.

The new days are cool too but

The old days.

And don’t get me wrong, I love the new stuff and I can’t imagine the MCU without Doctor Strange or Spidey, but sometimes I miss the simplier times 😔😔😔😔 y’know, with fics about all of the avengers living in the tower each with their own floors customized for them by Tony.

The old days were cool man.

The new days are cool too but

The old days.
